intro: Cyrtopera katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga Cyrtopera, is a rare and unique species of flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
